misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that to right-shift with wraparound, you must temporarily save the last element, shift the rest from right-to-left to avoid overwriting, then place the saved value into index 0.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No gap: this matches Java’s array semantics and correct in-place rotation logic. The right-to-left loop correctly prevents overwriting values that are still needed.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: None. Output is correct for all arraySize >= 0 (including 0 and 1).

misconceptions.inferred_category_name: None (correct notional model for array rotation)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they must preserve the last element before overwriting it, then shift elements from right-to-left to avoid losing values, and finally place the saved last element at index 0.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap detected. This matches Java’s execution and array assignment semantics: right-to-left shifting prevents overwriting needed values, and storing the last element preserves it for wrap-around.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces correct output for valid integer input.
